1.text: Job again took up his parable, and said,

2.text: “Oh that I were as in the months of old, as in the days when God watched over me;

3.text: when his lamp shone on my head, and by his light I walked through darkness,

4.text: as I was in the ripeness of my days, when the friendship of God was in my tent,

5.text: when the Almighty was yet with me, and my children were around me,

6.text: when my steps were washed with butter, and the rock poured out streams of oil for me,

7.text: when I went forth to the city gate, when I prepared my seat in the street.

8.text: The young men saw me and hid themselves. The aged rose up and stood.

9.text: The princes refrained from talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

10.text: The voice of the nobles was hushed, and their tongue stuck to the roof of their mouth.

11.text: For when the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it commended me:

12.text: Because I delivered the poor who cried, and the fatherless also, who had none to help him,

13.text: the blessing of him who was ready to perish came on me, and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.

14.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me. My justice was as a robe and a diadem.

15.text: I was eyes to the blind, and feet to the lame.

16.text: I was a father to the needy. The cause of him who I didn’t know, I searched out.

17.text: I broke the jaws of the unrighteous, and plucked the prey out of his teeth.

18.text: Then I said, ‘I shall die in my own house, I shall number my days as the sand.

19.text: My root is spread out to the waters. The dew lies all night on my branch.

20.text: My glory is fresh in me. My bow is renewed in my hand.’

21.text: “Men listened to me, waited, and kept silence for my counsel.

22.text: After my words they didn’t speak again. My speech fell on them.

23.text: They waited for me as for the rain. Their mouths drank as with the spring rain.

24.text: I smiled on them when they had no confidence. They didn’t reject the light of my face.

25.text: I chose out their way, and sat as chief. I lived as a king in the army, as one who comforts the mourners.
